You know just where to strike to temporarily stun a foe.
You must use this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} before you make your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} (thus, a failed attack roll ruins the attempt). Stunning Fist forces a foe {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damaged{/g} by your {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attack{/g} to make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} 10 + half your {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g} + your {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wis{/g} modifier), in addition to dealing damage normally. A defender who fails this saving throw is {g|ConditionStunned}stunned{/g} for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} (until just before your next turn). A stunned character drops everything held, can't take {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g}, loses any {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, and takes a â€“2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to AC. You may attempt a stunning attack once per day for every four levels you have attained, and no more than once per round. Constructs, oozes, plants, undead, incorporeal creatures, and creatures immune to {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} cannot be stunned.
